alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Nowata; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:54PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Craig, northwestern Delaware, Ottawa and southeastern Nowata Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 954 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of New Alluwe to 4 miles northwest of Seneca. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Vinita... Nowata... Grove... Fairland... Afton... Bernice... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Big Cabin... New Alluwe... Bernice State Park... Cleora... White Oak... Narcissa... Ottawa... Cayuga... Peoria... Pyramid Corners... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 275 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
